Authors:
Terry Jarianna Torres-Cruz, Alessandro Desiro, Gregory
Bonito, Andrea Porras-Alfaro
Title:
Bifiguratus adelaidae gen. et sp. nov., a new lineage of
Mucoromycotina with endophytic and soil-dwelling strains
Keywords:
Bryophyte, dimorphic, endophyte, Mucoromycotina, soil,
Pinaceae
Abstract:
Illumina sequencing of soil in a temperate pine forest in
the southeastern United States detected an abundant, N-responsive
genotype. Two isolates consistent with that genotype were subsequently
isolated in culture. Examination of records in GenBank revealed that a
genetically similar fungus had been isolated previously as an endophyte
of moss in a pine forest in the southwestern USA. These three isolates
were characterized using morphological and multi-locus molecular data
(18S, ITS, 28S rRNA sequences). Phylogenomic analysis revealed that the
taxon represents a novel lineage in the Mucoromycotina. The fungus is
dimorphic, grows best at room temperature, and presents epihyphal
bacteria including Bacillus licheniformis and Stenotrophomonas sp. Here
a new taxon is proposed.
